name: Bali Zoo
address: Jl. Raya Singapadu, Singapadu, Kec. Sukawati, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80582, Indonesia
review 1:
We booked breakfast with Orangutans and when we visited the zoo. Breakfast was amazing, but we came a bit late. Be there before 8am, so you can eat as there were a lot of empty plates at 9:20. So food finished and they didn‚Äôt bring any more.
We overslept and got there at 9:05. We still have nice food. However, don‚Äôt do our mistake and be there in time.
Around 9:25 they start taking animals back so you have to take your photos before.
We also fed elephants (u can buy food basket for 75k) and did lots of photos and videos. They are well looked after and some of them were rescued. Also 6 baby animals were born in this zoo ;)
Zoo is amazing. Lots of animals that I haven‚Äôt seen before in European zoos.
Must visit!
review 2: I loved this zoo and think it's well worth the visit, especially for children. Heaps to look at and fun activities for kids, like feeding the deer which are wandering freely. The tiger enclosure was too small but was told new expansion of the zoo will have larger enclosures. It is smallish so easy to get around and very interesting. Worth the visit üòÑ
review 3: Beautiful lush green surrounds. Can't believe you can usually ride a elephant if you are that way inclined. We walked in amongst some deer and little monkeys. That doesn't happen in Melbourne. What a treat. Well worth a visit kids or not.
review 4: A solo trip to Bali Zoo and I was left in awe of how many different species they had. The staff were super friendly and helpful! I enjoyed seeing the meerkats up close and feeding them, that‚Äôs an experience I won‚Äôt soon forget. Can‚Äôt wait to come back when I visit Bali next :)
review 5:
Very nice zoo. It is worth to go with kids and spend some time there. Food and drink all avaliable. All is kept very clean. Animals can move freely around.  Kids can feed animals, just being close as possible to the animals. The size of the zoo is perfect for kids. We love the place. Most of the walking paths are protected by trees, which makes it enjoyable
to walk around even during hot weather.

name: Tlaga Singha Bali
address: Jl. Raya Singapadu, Singapadu, Kec. Sukawati, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80582, Indonesia
review 1:
What a stunning place. We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves at Tlaga Singha River Club. We paid an entry fee which included a choice of 1 meal and Drink off the menu (cocktails were on the list) it also included towels. We sat in a hut over the water, we got to feed the fish, we had lunch which was absolutely delicious and the portions were big, the kids carbonara was incredibly yummy. Our son loved it.
We moved to the pool area were the staff organied us a table, it's so stunning and the staff are so helpful and friendly. We loved the pool on the below level and the Cocktails were to die for. Loved the view from the infinity pools. We Didn't get a cabana as we were in the pool and didn't need one.
I would recommend spending the day here. Our 8 year old absolutely loved it here as much as we did.
review 2: Gorgeous place! The water was a bit smelly but didn‚Äôt matter much. The food & drinks were delicious! I loved how the help my suitcase & kept it safe in a locked away room behind the reception.
review 3:
Typical tourist money trap. Our friends wanted to go so we went along to check it out. Although the pool is gorgeous, it's expensive and not worth it in my personal opinion.

It's minimum 200 000 to get in - which includes a towel, locker and a drink (juice, wine, beer or choice between two cocktails.)

300 000 will get you a wider range of cocktails to choose from and lunch. We got the nachos and a cheeseburger (Neither of them particularly exciting or flavourful. Very bland.)
Cocktails are alright, but they are the same as everywhere else.

If you want more comfort than a normal chair -  such as a beach chair between swims, you'll have to pay more.
If you want comfort AND shade be ready to pay even more (at least 500 000 for a cabana.)

Not allowed to bring any outside food or drinks, so you can't bring water or snacks. Everything has to be bought inside.

The staff was friendly and nice enough, but to be honest, we would have been better off staying at the hotel.
review 4: The whole place is magnificent! From their food to their staff, they are excellent! We had Wahyuni as our servicing staff and she is fabulous. Well worth the visit and experience!  Must visit in Singha Padu   in Bali!
review 5: Tlaga Singha was one of the biggest surprises during our stay in Bali. The team was very helpful with last-minute booking, was well informed about their 6pm swimming pool policy, as I have booked bed for 4pm. The place is stunning, swimmingpools are beautiful, and below pool and the roof is just wow. We had a great stay, it's  a gem in Ubud. Totally recommend.

name: Sanctoo Suites & Villas
address: Jalan Ulun Suwi II, Singapadu, Kec. Sukawati, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80582, Indonesia
review 1: Wonderful 5* stay. Beautiful location, superb room service and all kind of amenities of premium level. We stayed in Villa. Like a own big bungalow- with giant size bathroom and personal swimming pool. Free WiFi and water. Floating breakfast at our room swimming pool remained lifetime memorable experience. Food taste are really good. Nearby zoo is fantastic, so many new animals and birds we seen with great atmosphere. We all loved this Sanctoo Suites & Villas and recommended to all for the relaxed stay with nature
review 2: Excellent rooms with excellent service. Right beside Bali Zoo. I booked 2 std rooms. I requested to use 1 of the rooms for an extra half hour after the zoo trip for a quick freshening up. They were very kind to let us all use the room with new towels for no extra charges. Also got a complimentary photo shoot with edited pic. Room and vicinity were very clean. Staffs were friendly n helpful. Easy to get grab service to and from hotel. They also provide shuttle to town. Overall a pleasant stay.
review 3:
SancToo is the one of my family‚Äôs favorite place to stay. Since arrived we got warms welcome start from gate security guard, fantastic welcome at lobby by receptionist and comfortable room & clean.
Room service order absolutely good.
Wonderful lovely service at restaurant since arrived thru breakfast in the morning, delicious breakfast given.
Thanks to whole of management for your consistency to always make my family holiday are superb memorable.
Recommend place to stay for holiday.

Thanks
review 4: One of the best hotel I experienced. Amazing location and the service is simply top notch‚Ä¶. If you are after a nature break, easy access to the zoo, feel like you are in the jungle with great spa and facilities to relax, look no further.
review 5:
We booked a night at the resort to relax and unwind in the serenity as advertised.

Unfortunately there was a staff party for 4 hours of our 1 day stay which echoed around the resort for the full afternoon. Of course events are important but to charge a premium rate in a spa and give no prior warning I feel is a very poor customer experience. Response from the resort was, don't complain, this is how is.

Beautiful hotel, location etc but be warned your stay may be interrupted by loud noise without warning - which is not what a luxury spa would be.

name: Celuk Swing & Luwak Coffee
address: Jl. Jaga Raga No.40, Celuk, Kec. Sukawati, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80582, Indonesia
review 1:
We dropped in on the way back from a day trip
Free sampling of coffees and tea a wide selection approximately 15 which are complimentary
There is few swings for pictures and then the famous lewak coffee (cat poo)
Not complimentary it's 50,000 IDR but very nice
Staff very friendly
review 2:
üìçüå∏

A cafe unique, where secrets unfurl, ‚òïüåü
They explain the process, of Kopi Luwak, a rare pearl. üê±‚òï

Tasting teas and coffees, intriguing and bold, üçµüåü
From avocado to coconut, flavors to behold. ü•ëü••

Pandan tea and mangosteen brew, a sip so fine, üçÉüåü
A journey of flavors, with each unique line. üçµüå∫

Touristy swings, for play and photoshoots grand, üì∏üåü
Memories captured, in that enchanting land. üåüüé†

üìçüå∏
review 3:
Staff were surprisingly very courteous. No pressure given just clear pricing given. We picked a package for the girls with a dress and a photographer and the boys just the swing. Even then the staff still helped by using our phones to take amazing pictures.  No major que even though we went at 12. All coffees and teas clearly explained and beautiful views to drink it in.

Would recommend this to everyone.
review 4: Nice place to try tea and coffe, and you can try the swings to, trying the coffe and tea was free pop coffe(luwak) cost 50k /cup swings started from 200k
review 5: I came for the Bali swing, did not need to line up. It was fun, relaxing, have enjoyed the sky view and the natural surroundings. The staffs were friendly and took many professional pictures for me as souvenirs

name: YANYAN RESORT UBUD
address: Br. Penida, Jl. Raya Negara, Batuan, Kec. Sukawati, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80582, Indonesia
review 1: Go here, and stay here!  It's 20 min drive from Ubud Centre, but take it from me, don't go there.  Traffic is terrible, shops are not cheap.  This resort is quiet, peaceful.  4 min walk to a massage up the road, a day club near by if that's your thing, plus another excellent restaurant /resort close by.  Good hard beds, great staff.  Loved our three days here.
review 2: It‚Äôs just as beautiful as the photos! Hidden away in a quiet part just outside of the busy city centre! Peaceful, serene and breathtaking! The staff can‚Äôt do enough for you. Food in the restaurant is incredible! Great prices too, loved the floating breakfast! Highly recommend if you want to stay in ubud, but be out of the busyness! Thank you for a wonderful stay!
review 3: Excellent service and nice view from the hotel. The room and especially the bathroom is beautiful. However, room could have been cleaned better, there are barely any places to lay around the pool and restaurant quality could have been better.
review 4:
Hidden Gems in Ubud but far away from the center and no restaurants around the area. If you‚Äôre looking for a peaceful place and away from the crowds, this is the place to be.
The restaurant works fine but could have some Vegan options on the menu, since it‚Äôs so easy to achieve them in Bali nowadays.
Otherwise, service is really good, bedroom is also good and the atmosphere is just zen! üëåüèª
review 5:
After you pass the alley thru the hotel you will find an hidden paradise. The view in the morning it‚Äôs briliant, breakfast can be served on your room terrace or in the pool or at the normal table of restaurants. They house keeping everyday and it‚Äôs always clean. Food from restaurant it‚Äôs normal with good price, they will charge extra fee for serving and everything goes to the final bill at the check out.
All the staff is really friendly and polite with a big smile. üòä
Great experience!

name: Mammoth Art Gallery And Wood Carving
address: Jl. Raya Negara No.202, Batuan, Kec. Sukawati, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80582, Indonesia
review 1: Great art and outstanding wood sculptures, pirces are way too high though. Not to tkae anything away from the amazing craftsmanship.
review 2:
Various designs comparing to other store. The price in tag is expensive, but there is a room to negotiate and they are flexible.
The wood they use for this is very good one and I‚Äôm sure their products have the value matching with quality.
If you are interested in such ornaments, it‚Äôs great to stop by here.
review 3: The wood carvings at Mammoth are incredible. From the small to the incredibly large. We purchased a painted Barong carving to remind us of the captivating, traditional Balinese Barong play.
review 4: Enjoy the history of the wood carving in Bali. This place is run by families of wood carvers. Couldn't buy anything though, they sell in USD fyi. But you can watch and appreciate all their work for free. Some of their life size figures are so realistic that you'd be surprised when you first see them. The attention to detail is top class and no item is ever the same, so whatever you get here will surely be unique. They had geckos,dogs, cats, eagles, komodo dragons and horses even jaguars. Bali wood is a good souvenir and it changes color over time(from green to light greyish).
review 5: If you're looking for wood carvings from small to very large statement pieces, this is the place to go. Very intricate large scale wooden wall art and furniture also available. Six foot tall carvings of horses, dolphins, and religious figures available. Don't forget to negotiate.

name: The Cassowary Restaurant
address: Jalan Ulun Suwi II, Singapadu, Singapadu, Kec. Sukawati, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80582, Indonesia
review 1:
Waiting time for food was 50 minutes
The tax is 20% on the top
Portions size was too small
We ordered sandwich, pasta, pork ribs, and salad, and non of those dishes were really good. Picture of the salad represents the serving - not at all what you‚Äôre expecting to have for the price you pay. And by the way, 4 tiny cubes of avocado didn‚Äôt go well with the sweet sauce you serve it with.
Better choose different place for food.
review 2:
Horrible Service! They bring each drink seperate instead of bringing all at one time.
We needed to ask many Times for our food. My wife became first. After 1 hour we still had no food. We asked where our food is then they said they bring the wrong Menu. Normaly we paid 10 Million for the Elephant riding with Lunch including. After 1,5 hour they Tell us we need to pay. Never i will go here again.
review 3:
Great experience. Fantastic staff. Many food options if some of you are wanting bali food and some are wanting western food.

Try the local wine, I was pleasantly surprised. Agung Rai, the chef came and spoke to us at the end of the night to check we enjoyed our meal and spoke to us about what else we can do while we are in Bali.

Thank you all
review 4:
Just had a perfect dinner last night at this restaurant. All foods are great! (I even ordered a Tom Yum, which considered as a "tricky dish", but I could say that was one of the best Tom Yum that I'd ever eat in a non-Thai restaurant.)

The night ambience and vibes were cozy and the live music brought by Bli Agung Purwa (IG: agunggdepurwa) was top notch! Eventho it was only an acoustic session, the choice of songs, his voice & guitar strings - he was killin it!! Sanctoo needs to make him as a regular performer there.

No need to leave the hotel and search for foods in surrounding area if this hotel have a plenty of superb foods! Great job Sanctoo Restaurant!
review 5: The restaurant was actually next to Bali Zoo (I think its part of the Bali Zoo) whereby part of the villa resorts. Good place for family to stay and out and about to the zoo whilst you stay there. The foods were OK, nothing special.. although the service in the beginning was great but when there are many costumers around, they started to struggle to serve each table.

name: Central Food Village
address: C758+X66, Jl. Raya Singapadu, Singapadu, Kec. Sukawati, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80582, Indonesia
review 1: Unexpectedly very good food, especially for a tourist destination. Portions were large and overall high quality. Burger was wide and full, chips are clearly actual potato with skin still visible on edges. Sate ayam very good with delicious sauce. Place was quite packed (understandably - we dined at 1pm) but waitress was able to find us tucked away far from the counter.
review 2: Normally, tourist attractions have average food. Bali Zoo food was an exception offering many cusines that were affordable and tasty.
review 3: Very Unique Experience! Eating a good food in the heart of the zoo. Good for families and kids! Really recommend to go there where you in Ubud area!
review 4: The food was actually superb! We got their local delights - Soto Ayam and Nasi Campur with Chicken Sate. Absolutely loved their sambal - it was spicy and had a great kick to it.
review 5: Food were excellent. It taste good and quite a big portion for us, still aligned with the price. A good place to dine in while looking at the ostrich.

name: Beng beng waterfall
address: C76C+GFX, Jl. Uma Aya, Batuan, Kec. Sukawati, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80582, Indonesia
review 1: Polluted. Cannot swim in the water

name: Traditional Balinese House
address: C779+47G, Batuan, Sukawati, Gianyar Regency, Bali, Indonesia
review 1: This place offers a wide range of wonderful things. At first, I was quite afraid, but when I shared it with my friends, they thought it was really nice.
review 2: Nice place to buy silver jewelry
review 3: Very interesting to see a traditional set up
review 4:
traditional balinese house architecture
nice family that live there
review 5: Clean and beautiful, well preserved and interesting

name: Cave Club Bali
address: C759+4G8, Celuk, Sukawati, Gianyar Regency, Bali 80362, Indonesia

name: Bali Traditional House Gung Aji
address: Jalan Raya Negara No.100, Sukawati, Batuan, Kec. Gianyar, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80582, Indonesia
review 1: What I really missed was some kind of  guided tour. Yes the people were happy to explain some things but I still would have liked the option of a set guide
review 2: They are simple the best carpenters of Bali! We tried to go to many different places after, but we came back! Just the best, expensive as well but you really need to negotiate.
review 3: A must see if in Ubud. Great little traditional house with people still living the traditional Balinese way. You can walk around at your leisure
review 4: Balinese traditional house. Just come if you want to know the old Balinese house. They just kept it all of the generations in the modern era.
review 5: Fun place if you like to sample different coffees, all served up to you on a tray with a dozen or so coffees to try.

name: SnackSnacks
address: Gianyar, Singapadu, Kec. Sukawati, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80582, Indonesia
review 1: They have best ambience to chill and relax if you tired after getting around the zoo. The foods and the drinks is the best
review 2:
Nice small place.
Good coffee, good ambience.
After walking around the zoo, this is the perfect place in have a good rest.
review 3: Come and visit this cafe after/before entering the zoo‚úåüèª
review 4: Great food, service, and ambiance with affordable prices :)
review 5: Coffee is really good. Croissant was not fresh

name: Lawar Plek lantang hidung
address: C75C+38Q, Jl. Lettu Nengah Duaji, Batuan, Kec. Sukawati, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80582, Indonesia

name: The Sandwich Bar at Bali Zoo
address: Jl. Raya Singapadu, Singapadu, Kec. Sukawati, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80582, Indonesia
review 1: Sandwiches are delicious, slightly on the pricier side but the portion sizes are good. They have a good vegan option too! Service is a little slow though. Love the view of the greenery from the cafe. The last time we came here it was not crowded at all but it took more than 30 minutes for us to get our food.

name: Nasi Lawar Men Rawi
address: C75C+38H, Jl. Lettu Nengah Duaji, Batuan, Kec. Sukawati, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80582, Indonesia
review 1: The best lawar i ever try

name: River Valley Villa
address: C778+5PP, Batuan, Sukawati, Gianyar Regency, Bali 80582, Indonesia
review 1: River Valley Villa with private pool is part of Yan Yan resort
review 2: Unbeatable views and  great staff, good for couples and family

name: Abhynusa Gallery
address: Gianyar, Jl. Raya Negara No.100, Batuan, Kec. Sukawati, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80582, Indonesia

name: Bali Gong Art & Painting
address: Jl. Raya Negara, Batuan, Kec. Sukawati, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80582, Indonesia

name: Made House
address: Br.Penida, Batuan, Kec. Sukawati, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80582, Indonesia
